It’s only been mere days since the discovery of TESS’s first planet, Pi Mensae c, but now it’s second discovery has been reported. LHS 3844 b is a Super-Earth orbiting one of the nearest known red dwarf stars every 11 hours. It is currently the closest Ultra-Short Period planet ever found, and has one of the shortest known orbital periods. 

https://arxiv.org/pdf/1809.07242.pdf
11 hour orbital period! I vote to call this planet Speedy Gonzales.

I wonder if it'd be better if you or someone else made a separate thread for all TESS discoveries (With new planets in the OP), merging the two you've already made. This forum is gonna get pretty cluttered pretty quick in the next couple years otherwise
